annotation.TEXT: This level has a lot of poison mushrooms, so be careful. (At least their blocks are clearly visible here. In Super Mario All-Stars, these blocks are invisible until they're hit.)
Okay, now this part's tricky. Kind of like the other "maze" castles, I have to take the lowest route here, or the room will loop. However, the small platforms and the uber fire bar make this tricky.
So, who should I use for world 9? Place your votes now! (Note: 9-1, 9-2, and 9-4 are water levels, and I don't think there are any power ups to get at all in world 9.) To be continued... Yo!
Got it. If it got above me there, it would've become difficult to shoot.
So, here's where 8-2's goal actually is.
Okay, now to reveal it and then send it towards the lava on the left.
After that long hallway, we come to another tricky part. Come on, I know there's a horizontal green parakoopa over there...
Perfect. (By the way, if I was using a faster character, I think I could've gotten a 1-up combo here.)
Very good. Now just don't miss any of the last three...
Alright, let's tear apart this bonus room.
Oh, nice. Sophia gets unlimited Hover power during the star power.
And with this flagpole grab, I shall pass a million points! Huzzah!
At least that hidden power up block gets me rebigulated, but not having fireballs could make things trickier. Speaking of tricky, the jump to this pipe over here is somewhat tricky.

Very good. Now, there's a star here, which I'll happily grab. Also, I'm supposed to climb up the vine here to complete the level, but I'm going to show the incorrect path first. It's not very long, so I'm not worried about the time limit.
And, since 8-4 has many tricky spots, it's certainly a possibility.
Kind of. It didn't quite have that same instant KA-BLAMMO effect, but I did off him before he could toss any spinies.
Oh, what the heck! I don't remember that fire bar being that difficult to dodge in the original game. Mario, better start warming up, since there may be a pitching change soon.
But, fortunately, in Crossover, I don't have to do anything special (like beat the first 8 worlds warpless in one playing session) to access world 9!
Alright, 8-3 is done!
Excellent!
Alright, let's see if I can finally get a perfect in one of these sky bonus areas. Sophia III should be greatly helpful for this.
I think if I was a bit faster, I could've clobbered that Flurry with my star power, but whatever.
I had a couple of close calls there. That would've been silly if I let Sophia ingest that poison mushroom. Also, I'm sorry for trivializing this level with a projectile user.
Ha, take that, minus sign! Yeah, so obviously, I'm back to an earlier part of the level, just before the springboard.
Alright, Bowser's defeated, but the level's not over yet, because that one was just a decoy. The real Bowser is a bit further ahead.
There's a poison mushroom in the third ? block here, but I want to deal with the Blooper here first before I reveal it.
Huh. That's weird. I wonder why I got "1000" twice from that first Hammer Brother...
I got an Operation C Bill this time.
(...Triforce, whatever.)
Bah. I would've consumed that poison while I was invincible there, but I somehow snagged on the blocks in a weird way. Oh, well.

I should have enough time to finish, but had I fallen onto that pipe near the decoy Bowser, I most likely would've ended up timing out, since it took me about 3/4 of the time limit to get here the first time.
Alright, here's an underwater section, which having fireballs makes easier, because I can get rid of the Jellies.
Umm... I'm not gonna try to jump in between those Flurries (Buzzies). I can just back up and hop on this block and wait.
Ah, one of those bricks was a coin block, to prevent an unwinnable situation. I figured that might be the case. Alright, up the vine I go!
There it is. So, be careful of that while you're dealing with the parakoopa.
Unfortunately, in Crossover, it appears that there's no special rescue sequence for beating Lost Levels 8-4, and I just get the usual "Another Castle" scene.
Oh, neat! ...Yeah, that's definitely a powerful cheat, which I'm probably never gonna use! (I'm guessing it was unlocked by killing a certain number of enemies.)
Okay, I know this level has a low-flying Lakitu early on here. Can I ambush him the same way I did with Samus in 7-2?
Alright, here's the final area of 8-4, and just one screen to the right is... Bowser!
Upon landing, make sure you open up this block. It's got a star!
COINS!!! ...And more poison...
Okay, Luigi obviously gets first dibs on 8-4 with his 10 votes, and I'm going to pick the NES Peach skin. However, I will give Mario a chance here if Luigi/Peach somehow meets his/her demise.
Doesn't look like it (unless there was a hidden block that I didn't think to check for there). Oh, well. It's not terribly important.

Yep, Luigi actually got 10 votes there, most of which being for 8-4. But, Mario's votes favored 8-4 as well, so he's kind of competing against Luigi there. On the other hand, Bill had an 8-2 vote, and Sophia's vote was for 8-3. So, let's start with a random Bill for 8-2.
There's another poison mushroom in a hidden block somewhere around here...
OMNOMNOM! Apparently, star power gives me a cast-iron stomach or something, which allows me to eat poison mushrooms with no ill effects.
Also, Lakitu doesn't stick around in this level for very long, even if I didn't kill him, so I don't expect him to respawn.

I guess I'll go with Sophia for 8-3, though maybe I could've gone with Mario here instead, since 2 of his 4 votes didn't specify a level. Well, if Sophia somehow epic fails, I'll try Mario for 8-3 here.
Lost Levels sky bonus perfects: 1
There's a poison mushroom here which I'm going to try to carefully reveal.
Oh, man. Gotta make a one-tile landing here. I'll use the tens digit of my coins as a guide.
Alright, it's real boss time!

Huh. The bricks connected to the pipes now produce coins this time. Earlier, in 7-1's bonus room that looks just like this, those bricks were breakable instead (click this annotation to see it). (UPDATE: I've mentioned this on the ER forums.)
Nice, made that pinpoint landing again. It's trickier than you might think, because the Contra guys can't stop moving horizontally in the air once they start. They can only change direction.
There's gonna be another potentially annoying Jelly to the right up ahead, and I want to fry it quickly.
Peach OP. Please nerf. (Just kidding. This probably would've been really tricky if I was small.)
Oh, and the alt. skin votes included an SMB2 skin and the Demon skin for Mario, and Peach & SMB1 SNES Luigi for... Luigi, obviously.
Excellent. Now, before heading into the pipe, be sure to collect this hidden power up over here. (Sorry, Mario. It looks like I won't be making that pitching change after all.)
Umm... Can I reach that "R"?
Whoa, that was close.

Fortunately, it appears that I did it correctly (or at least, in a way that was acceptable for Crossover). You might've seen the fire bar and parakoopa "skip" a little bit back there as I hit the correct route.
Not every block here has poison, though. You'll definitely want to climb up this vine if you're looking for coins!
Okay, it just went straight into the lava on the right. I'm fine with that. (I expected it to instead bump into the left side of that block down there and travel to the left.)
Hello, and welcome back to SMB Crossover, where I'll be finishing off world 8 today! The voting results are up above as usual.
Now, someone did vote for me not to use a projectile-user in 8-3, but I think the entire roster is capable of firing projectiles (though power ups or ammo are needed for some of them).
To begin with, I've gotta carefully land on the lower level here, then time a long jump so that I don't hit the fire bar on the other side.

Now, that pipe in the little pit down there will send you back to near the start of the level, and you don't even want to fall onto the pipe, because there are hidden coin blocks above it that'll box you in.

Okay, my target is the first pipe there. Unlike in some other cases, I'm not going to show the wrong paths in this level, especially since I believe the first wrong path here (not entering the first pipe) will have me assaulted by flying cheepos!
Nuts. I wanted to blow that koopa up.
